title: Tamarind and Chilli Barbecued Lamb Chops

ingredients.content: 10 g fresh root ginger, peeled, cut in round slices (2 mm)
1 ripe mango, large, cut in pieces

preparations.content: Place onions, ginger, garlic and chilli in mixing bowl then chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>.
Add mango, tamarind paste, treacle, allspice, red wine and orange juice then cook <b>25 min/98°C/speed <b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add vinegar and, without measuring cup, cook <b>10 min/100°C/speed <b>. Insert measuring cup then blend <b>1 min/speed 10<b>.
Place lamb chops on barbecue or under a hot grill (220°C). When charred, flip over and char other side.

Brush each chop generously with tamarind and mango sauce then move to cooler part of barbecue, or lower under the grill. Cook for 5-8 minutes, turning over halfway to baste other side. Serve immediately or keep warm.

hintsAndTricks: Add extra jalapeños or hotter chillies for more heat.
